[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[hcell style="border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver;" colspan="2"]]
PRIMARY FACTORY ACTOR:
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black;  padding: 0 1%" colspan="2"]]
* Master Foreman Kowalewicz[[footnote]] [[span style="font-family: Monospace; font-size: 10pt;"]] Foreman ID: INV64425516[[/span]] [[/footnote]]

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]

[[hcell style="border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver;"colspan="2"]]
OTHER PARTICIPATING  FACTORY ACTORS:
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black;  padding: 0 1%" colspan="2"]]
* Secretary Adriana Ramirez[[footnote]] Worker ID: SEA657562698 [[/footnote]]

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[hcell style="border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver;"colspan="2"]]
RELEVANT PRIOR INFORMATION:
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black;  padding: 0 1%" colspan="2"]]
Chicago Spirit founder Richard Chappell reached out to the Factory Administrative Department in order to arrange a meeting with Master Foreman Kowalewicz, the lead foreman on [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/chicago-factory/offset/0 Product 03265972]. 
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[hcell style="border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver;"colspan="2"]]
DESCRIPTION:
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black;  padding: 0 1%" colspan="2"]]
Chappell was greeted warmly by Foreman Kowalewicz at noon on March 3rd, 1932. After explaining his grievances, Foreman Kowalewicz asked of the manner in which Chappell was using Product 03265972. Chappell was offered a tour of IL-9128657-NEM //gratis// in order to display the method in which the byproducts of Product 03265972 were used.

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[hcell style="border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver;"colspan="2"]]
TRIGGER:
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black;  padding: 0 1%" colspan="2"]]

After using Product 03265972 to dispose of items related to a Chicago Spirit Operation[[footnote]]See File on Incident IL-020332-CHSP [[/footnote]], Chappell stated that the output was less than satisfactory. [[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Leader, Richard Chappell: I've got twenty barrels of booze that look, taste, and even //sound// like the shits an elephant takes when they realize that they've been taken in by Herman fucking Fuller. We were promised a fuckin' high-quality product, and that's twenty malfunctions, out of the twenty-five we ordered. 'Unacceptable' is an understatement.
[[/footnote]] Chappell came to confront Foreman Kowalewicz alongside Julius McGallan.[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Enforcer, Julius McGallan: We can respect that you have limited time, but do you know how much twenty barrels of booze is in Greenbacks? It'd buy you a good half of the legislature, and I //know// they're startin' to look into plants like this.


[[/footnote]]
[[footnote]] Julius McGallan's statement was construed as a threat. It is unclear if any action should be taken at this time.[[/footnote]]

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[hcell style="border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver;" colspan="2"]]
ORDER OF EVENTS
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
**Actor Action**
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
**Factory Response**
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Chappell and McGallan arrive on the grounds of IL-9128657-NEM.

[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Adriana Ramirez greets the pair of outside Actors.

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Chappell asks to see the foreman in charge.

[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Ramirez summons Kowalewicz from the factory floor, stating that Mr. Chappell and Mr. McGallan are here to see him.[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Leader, Richard Chappell: I never told you my name.
[[/footnote]] Foreman Kowalewicz appears before the two clients some minutes later.

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Chappell and McGallan inquire as to the nature of the failing of the products delivered.

[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]

[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Foreman Kowalewicz expresses regret at the situation, and offers a tour of the factory floor.[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Leader, Richard Chappell: What, are you kidding? I came here looking to fix your shit, not to sight-see.
[[/footnote]]
[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Foreman Kowalewicz: I assure you, Mister Chappell, that the reasons for the barrel's malfunction shall become clear after a brief tour. All I ask for is your patience for a few minutes.
[[/footnote]] Chappell acquiesces, and McGallan reluctantly agrees to accompany him.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Chappell and McGallan enter the factory floor, escorted by Foreman Kowalewicz. Chappell notes that they recognize some of the workers, who have been recruited through the use of Product 03265972. [[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Leader, Richard Chappell: Would you look at that. It's the Cook County commissioner. You've seen better days, haven't you, you old sack of shit? 
[[/footnote]]
[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Enforcer, Julius McGallan: That's god damn disgusting. So if he's here, I'm guessing the boys from the shootout are knocking around here somewhere too?
[[/footnote]] They inquire as to the absence of several individuals who were eliminated during the aforementioned Chicago Spirit operation.
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Foreman Kowalewicz offers a five-minute stop to all machinery for inspection and invites Chappell and McGallan over to examine a metal shaper.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
McGallan steps forward first, to check if it is safe for Chappell to inspect. He immediately recoils upon seeing the inner workings, and Chappell steps forward, finding the contents of the machine to his liking.
[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Leader, Richard Chappell: Is that what happens to the dead ones we stuff in? Didn't think human bones were sturdy enough. Real impressive set-up you've got going on here, Kowalewicz. I admire your efficiency.
[[/footnote]]
[[footnote]] Julius McGallan declined to comment at this point.[[/footnote]]



[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Master Foreman Kowalewicz roughly explains the mechanism behind Product 03265972's liquor conversion.
[[footnote]]
@@@@ 
> Master Foreman Kowalewicz:  The liquor that is delivered in exchange for the goods placed inside the product is determined by whether they are alive or dead. Living individuals transmute into liquor in a manner roughly corresponding to whichever areas of the world are currently experiencing night time. Then, they are integrated into our workforce.
[[/footnote]]
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]

[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Master Foreman Kowalewicz continues his explanation.
[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Master Foreman Kowalewicz: However, individuals who have expired prior to arrival are of little use on the work floor. I can assure you we do not let them go to waste, however, we find other ways for them to work with our machinery. Unfortunately, the liquor delivered winds up lacking in quality because of the lack of living tissue. For this, you have my sincerest apologies, Mister Chappell.
[[/footnote]]
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Chappell shows understanding as to why the product has been acting in error, and thanks Master Foreman Kowalewicz for his time.
[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Leader, Richard Chappell: Keeping them alive saves us bullets anyways.

[[/footnote]]
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Master Foreman Kowalewicz offers to escort the two non-Factory actors out of the building. McGallan rushes ahead, citing illness.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Exiting the building, Chappell, McGallan, and Kowalewicz encounter Chicago Spirit Organization Delivery Driver, Donald Smith, loading several unused instances of Product 03265972.
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
As a show of goodwill, Kowalewicz offers for an additional half-pallet to be loaded onto the truck //gratis//.

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Donald Smith, unused to the appearance of a Factory Master Foreman, drops the item he is currently loading and proceeds to enter his car and drive without securing his load, causing destruction of product.
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Kowalewicz apologizes for not reverting to a more publicly acceptable form and asks that the Non-Factory Actors wait for a new shipment to be loaded and delivered.

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]
Chappell extends his hand to Foreman Kowalewicz and expresses an interest in continued business.[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Chicago Spirit Organization Leader, Richard Chappell: Let me know if you ever get tired of breathing all that god damn smoke. Brains and brawns are a killer combo and you'd be a top dog in no time.
[[/footnote]]
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: 0 1%"]]

Foreman Kowalewicz and Chappell shake hands, Kowalewicz praises Chappell's practices.[[footnote]]
@@@@
> Master Foreman Kowalewicz: I am flattered, Mister Chappell, though I must say I admire your ruthless efficiency and intrigue. You would do well as a Foreman in my Factory.
[[/footnote]]
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[hcell style="border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver;"colspan="2"]]
RESULTS/FOLLOW UP
[[/hcell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black;  padding: 0 1%" colspan="2"]]
Incident was resolved amicably. Orders of Product 03265972 by the Chicago Spirit have increased. However, due to the guidance given by Master Foreman Kowalewicz, the amount of replacement parts created as byproduct of Product 03265972 has decreased sharply. Suggest finding new avenues for organic part acquisition, possibly from Slaughterhouse IL-249. 

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[/table]]


---------
author: Uncle Nicolini
